page.title: 08 A SCHOOLGIRL-1900-WEST ROW
page.content: I STARTED SCHOOL-THE ONE IN THE VILLAGE-WHEN I WAS 4 YEARS OLD. I STAYED THERE TILL I WAS NEARLY 14. IN THOSE DAYS,IF YOU HAD ATTENDED REGULARLY,YOU WERE ALLOWED TO LEAVE BEFORE THE OTHERS. MOST OF US WALKED TO SCHOOL BUT THOSE WHO LIVED WAY DOWN IN THE FEN CAME BY HORSE AND CART. THERE WAS NO SCHOOL UNIFORM BUT THE HEADMASTER LIKED THE GIRLS TO WEAR A PINAFORE AND THE BOYS A LARGE WHITE CELLULOID COLLAR OVER THEIR CLOTHES. WE LEARNT TO READ,WRITE AND DO SUMS-WE USED TO CHANT OUR TABLES.WE WROTE ON SLATES-IN WINTER THESE WERE SO COLD THAT WE WORE MITTENS. AT PLAYTIMES,A HIGH FENCE SEPARATED THE BOYS FROM THE GIRLS.ON A HOT DAY A BUCKET OF COLD WATER AND AN ENAMEL MUG WERE PUT IN THE PORCH FOR US.
